problems.title: Mop Not Scrubbing or Lifting
problems.description: The VibraRise feature isn't working on carpets or stains.
solution_steps: Remove and slide the mop cloth fully onto the bracket.
Clean the lifting mechanism of dust.

problems.title: Error: Filter Blocked or Wet
problems.description: Robot stops and complains about the filter even if cleaned.
solution_steps: If used for >6 months, replace it.

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a S7 / S7+ Robot Vacuum?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $351 vacuum, and extending the life of your Roborock is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my S7 / S7+ Robot Vacuum needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include intermittent power and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my S7 / S7+ Robot Vacuum myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
